snippet: Major League Baseball and the players’ union agreed Friday to new rules designed to produce faster games, including countdown clocks for breaks between innings.
abstract: Major League Baseball and players' union agree to new rules designed to quicken pace of play, including countdown clocks for breaks between innings and modifications to instant-replay process; umpires will also reinforce standing rule that requires hitters to keep at least one foot in batter’s box except for certain circumstances like wild pitch.

byline.contributor: Tim Rohan contributed reporting from Port St. Lucie, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball and the players’ union agreed Friday to new rules designed to produce faster games, including countdown clocks for breaks between innings.

headline.main: New Rules Are Set Out to Reduce the Length of M.L.B. Games
headline.print_headline: Major League Baseball Issues New Rules to Quicken the Pace of Games
